description: National Constraint Intelligence — UK. 3–6 high-signal structural metrics per constraint of life. Prefer ONS, NHS, Home Office, Bank of England, Ofgem, Ofcom, UKHSA. Avoid opinion surveys (unless long-running and methodologically stable) and one-off or experimental datasets.

metrics.exact_metric_name: Brent Crude Oil Price (Europe, USD per barrel)
metrics.dataset_or_series_id: FRED: DCOILBRENTEU
metrics.update_frequency: Daily (we use annual average for structural signal)
metrics.why_it_matters: UK is a net energy importer; oil price drives input costs, inflation, and physical constraint on industry and households.

metrics.exact_metric_name: UK Total Primary Energy Consumption (terajoules)
metrics.dataset_or_series_id: ONS: UK Energy Statistics (DUKES) — Table 1.1 Total energy consumption
metrics.why_it_matters: Structural measure of energy demand and efficiency; slow-moving, comparable across time and region.

metrics.exact_metric_name: Domestic electricity and gas prices (pence per kWh)
metrics.publishing_body: Office of Gas and Electricity Markets (Ofgem)
metrics.dataset_or_series_id: Ofgem: Domestic energy market indicators / Price cap data
metrics.update_frequency: Quarterly (price cap); annual averages for structural comparison
metrics.why_it_matters: Direct physical constraint on households and small business; regionally comparable, credible regulator.

metrics.exact_metric_name: UK Natural Gas Production (million tonnes of oil equivalent)
metrics.publishing_body: Department for Energy Security and Net Zero (DESNZ) / ONS
metrics.dataset_or_series_id: ONS: Digest of UK Energy Statistics (DUKES) — indigenous production
metrics.why_it_matters: Domestic supply capacity; declining North Sea production is a long-run structural constraint.

metrics.exact_metric_name: Total fertility rate (births per woman)
metrics.dataset_or_series_id: ONS: Births in England and Wales / World Bank SP.DYN.TFRT.IN for GB
metrics.why_it_matters: Determines future labour supply and dependency ratios; moves slowly, methodologically stable.

metrics.exact_metric_name: Age dependency ratio (% of working-age population)
metrics.publishing_body: World Bank (sourced from ONS and UN demographic estimates)
metrics.dataset_or_series_id: World Bank: SP.POP.DPND — GB
metrics.why_it_matters: Structural constraint on pensions, healthcare and tax base; long historical depth, internationally comparable.

metrics.exact_metric_name: Life expectancy at birth (years)
metrics.dataset_or_series_id: ONS: National life tables (e.g. period expectation of life at birth)
metrics.why_it_matters: Health and biological constraint on workforce and care demand; ONS is the canonical UK source.

metrics.exact_metric_name: Deaths registered in England and Wales (annual)
metrics.dataset_or_series_id: ONS: Deaths registered in England and Wales — annual summary
metrics.why_it_matters: Crude mortality level and trend indicate biological stress and demographic drag; stable methodology.

metrics.exact_metric_name: UK Central government debt (% of GDP)
metrics.dataset_or_series_id: World Bank: GC.DOD.TOTL.GD.ZS — GB
metrics.why_it_matters: Fiscal headroom and sustainability; structural constraint on future spending and rates.

metrics.exact_metric_name: Bank of England official bank rate (policy rate, %)
metrics.dataset_or_series_id: BoE: IUDBEDR (official bank rate) — Statistical Interactive Database
metrics.why_it_matters: Monetary constraint on credit and inflation; credible, high-frequency, no key required.

metrics.exact_metric_name: Public sector net debt excluding public sector banks (% of GDP)
metrics.dataset_or_series_id: ONS: Public sector finances — PSND ex (PSNB) as % GDP
metrics.update_frequency: Monthly (with revisions); use annual for structural
metrics.why_it_matters: Broader than central government debt; UK-specific, ONS is the national statistician.

metrics.exact_metric_name: CPI Annual rate (Consumer Prices Index, %)
metrics.dataset_or_series_id: ONS: CPIH or CPI — D7BT (annual rate)
metrics.why_it_matters: Inflation is a core economic constraint on real incomes and monetary policy.

metrics.exact_metric_name: Fixed broadband subscriptions (per 100 people)
metrics.publishing_body: World Bank / ITU (UK data aligned with Ofcom)
metrics.dataset_or_series_id: World Bank: IT.NET.BBND.P2 — GB
metrics.why_it_matters: Infrastructure penetration as informational constraint; low = structural drag on productivity.

metrics.exact_metric_name: Research and development expenditure (% of GDP)
metrics.publishing_body: Office for National Statistics (ONS) / World Bank
metrics.dataset_or_series_id: World Bank: GB.XPD.RSDV.GD.ZS — GB
metrics.why_it_matters: Investment in knowledge and innovation; structural indicator of informational capacity.

metrics.exact_metric_name: UK internet use (proportion of adults using internet)
metrics.dataset_or_series_id: ONS: Internet access — households and individuals
metrics.why_it_matters: Digital inclusion; ONS survey is long-running and methodologically stable.

metrics.exact_metric_name: Full fibre broadband availability (% of premises)
metrics.dataset_or_series_id: Ofcom: Connected Nations report — full fibre coverage
metrics.why_it_matters: Infrastructure constraint on speed and reliability; regulator data, regionally comparable.

metrics.exact_metric_name: Crime in England and Wales — offences per 1,000 population
metrics.dataset_or_series_id: ONS: Crime in England and Wales — police recorded crime, offences per 1,000
metrics.why_it_matters: Social stress and institutional trust; ONS is the canonical source, methodologically stable.

metrics.exact_metric_name: Unemployment rate (% of total labour force)
metrics.dataset_or_series_id: World Bank: SL.UEM.TOTL.ZS — GB
metrics.why_it_matters: Labour market stress and social cohesion; long historical depth, internationally comparable.

metrics.exact_metric_name: Number of people on out-of-work benefits (e.g. Universal Credit, legacy benefits)
metrics.publishing_body: Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) / ONS
metrics.dataset_or_series_id: DWP: Stat-Xplore or ONS benefit claimant count
metrics.why_it_matters: Structural dependency and labour market exclusion; UK-specific, credible.

metrics.exact_metric_name: Homicide rate (per million population)
metrics.publishing_body: Office for National Statistics (ONS) / Home Office
metrics.dataset_or_series_id: ONS: Homicide in England and Wales — rate per million
metrics.why_it_matters: Extreme social fragility indicator; low frequency but high signal, stable definition.

required_for: Optional for ONS time series API (faster rate limits). Many ONS datasets are available without key via public URLs.
ONS_API_KEY.note: Optional; use for higher throughput or specific time-series API.

no_api_key_required: World Bank API (all indicators used for GB)
Bank of England Statistical Interactive Dataset (IUDBEDR)
Ofgem / Ofcom / ONS — many releases via public spreadsheets or CSV; automated APIs may require keys as noted above.
